content: Malaysian professional footballer (born 1997) **Dominic Tan Jun Jin** ([simplified Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 陈俊仁; [traditional Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 陳俊仁; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *Chén Jùnrén*; born 12 March 1997) is a professional [footballer](/wiki/Association_football) who plays as a [centre-back](/wiki/Defender_(association_football)) for [Malaysia Super League](/wiki/Malaysia_Super_League) club [Sabah FC](/wiki/Sabah_F.C._(Malaysia)) Born in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), he represents [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia_national_football_team) at international level. ## Early life and education Tan was born in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) to [Malaysian Chinese](/wiki/Malaysian_Chinese) parents that moved from [Penang](/wiki/Pulau_Pinang) to Singapore for work. He was also in the [National Football Academy](/wiki/National_Football_Academy_(Singapore)) (NFA). Tan also studied at the [Singapore Sports School](/wiki/Singapore_Sports_School). ## Club career ### Harimau Muda C Tan began his senior career playing in Malaysia, representing [Harimau Muda C](/wiki/Harimau_Muda_C) in the [FAM League](/wiki/FAM_League). ### Johor Darul Ta'zim In 2016, Tan signed with [Johor Darul Ta'zim](/wiki/Johor_Darul_Ta%27zim_F.C.). He played with the second team in the [Malaysia Premier League](/wiki/Malaysia_Premier_League) and then promoted to the main squad of for the [Malaysia Super League](/wiki/Malaysia_Super_League) and [Malaysia Cup](/wiki/Malaysia_Cup). He made his debut in a 3–0 away defeat against Perak in the [2018 Malaysia Cup](/wiki/2018_Malaysia_Cup). #### Vilaverdense (loan) On 25 January 2018, Johor Darul Ta'zim have confirmed that Tan will leave for Portuguese third division club [Vilaverdense](/wiki/Vilaverdense_F.C.) on 27 January 2018 for a year-long loan stint. In early May, it was confirmed that Tan would return to Johor six months early alongside teammate [Syamer Kutty Abba](/wiki/Syamer_Kutty_Abba). #### Police Tero (loan) In 2019, Tan joined [Police Tero](/wiki/Police_Tero_F.C.) that plays in [Thai League 2](/wiki/Thai_League_2) on loan from Johor Darul Ta'zim. He made his first appearances with Police Tero B team in a match against Air Force United B in the [2019 Thai League 4](/wiki/2019_Thai_League_4). He made his debut in the [2019 Thai League 1](/wiki/2019_Thai_League_1) with Police Tero first team coming in as a substitute in the last minute against Air Force United. ### Police Tero During the 2020 season, Tan signed a two-year contract with Police Tero. ### Sabah In 2022, Tan joined [Sabah](/wiki/Sabah_F.C._(Malaysia)) that plays in [Malaysia Super League](/wiki/Malaysia_Super_League). He made his debut in the opening match of 2022 Malaysia Super League against [Negeri Sembilan](/wiki/Negeri_Sembilan_FC) at the Likas Stadium. On 1 September 2022, Tan scored his first goal for Sabah in a 2–2 draw against Kuala Lumpur, which also his first goal in the first division of Malaysian League. ## International career Tan previously represented the youth team of the Singapore national football team while living in Singapore as a permanent resident.[*citation needed*] In 2016, Tan was called up for the Malaysia national under-22 team for the inaugural Nations Cup. Later in August, he made his first start in a friendly match against Bahrain, with the match ending in a 0–0 draw. In 2017, he was selected for the Dubai Cup Football Tournament. In 2018, Tan played for the national under-23 team in the [2018 AFC U-23 Championship](/wiki/2018_AFC_U-23_Championship) and [2018 Asian Games](/wiki/2018_Asian_Games) which Malaysia qualify into the knockout round. In June 2019, he made his [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia_national_football_team) senior debut in a friendly match against [Nepal](/wiki/Nepal_national_football_team). Tan also represented the nation at the [2023 AFC Asian Cup](/wiki/2023_AFC_Asian_Cup), and was part of the first eleven during the [group stage match where Malaysia tied Korea 3-3](/wiki/2023_AFC_Asian_Cup_Group_E#South_Korea_vs_Malaysia). ## Career statistics ### Club *As of 11 January 2025*Appearances and goals by club, season and competition. title: Dominic Tan
